meanings.definition: To migrate back to one's original place or country.
meanings.sent1: After living in a different country for many years, Maria decided to remigrate to her hometown.
meanings.sent2: The birds remigrate to warmer regions when winter approaches.
meanings.sent3: The lost cat tried to remigrate to its old house, thinking it was its home.
meanings.sent4: The memories of his childhood made him want to remigrate to the familiar streets.
meanings.sent5: The idea to remigrate filled her heart with joy and nostalgia.

meanings.definition: To return to a previous location or state.
meanings.sent1: The software update caused the computer to remigrate to its previous settings.
meanings.sent2: The river water will remigrate to its natural course after the dam is removed.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made the coin remigrate to the volunteer's pocket.
meanings.sent4: The old photo helped him remigrate to the happy times of his youth.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the flowers made her mind remigrate to the garden of her childhood.
